EXTRACTED VALUE: It’s often a glitchy and shallow experience, yet you’ll have an absolute blast playing it.
A bit too repetitive for its own good, but the unique controls and the online co-op are quite nice indeed.
Eternal Sonata is a wonderful ensemble of fascinating characters and a remarkable story about the life (and death) of Frederic Chopin.
The game is much better than what I expected it to be, but the flaws cannot be overlooked.
The combat is a piece of cake since you don’t have to worry about a pressing some elaborate button combination to pull off your moves.
A solid battle system is flanked hour after hour by attention-grabbing cutscenes and cinematics. Fun to watch, fun to play.
